primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human individual must recognize the infinite value of their soul and choose to 'sell' it to God rather than to the perishing world.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the 'cheapness' of earthly prizes and the anxiety of the nuclear age, rather than a radical hamartiology of total depravity.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preservation of the soul through the 'hiding place' of Christ amidst global destruction.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical choice of 'selling' the soul to God provides the therapeutic benefit of safety from the 'tempest'.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on awakening the hearer's desire (Vouloir) and sense of obligation (Devoir) by appealing to their knowledge (Savoir) of their own worth.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the horror of being a 'commodity' (~S1) to the impossibility of 'neutrality' (~S2), urging a move toward 'Eternal Integrity' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the hearer making a better 'deal' with God than with the world.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is depicted as 'ugly' and 'doomed', but primarily as a bad financial/existential investment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language at the end, the actantial structure is anthropocentric. The human is the Subject who must decide the price of their soul. God is the 'hiding place' (Helper) or the 'Owner' (Object), but not the primary Actor of the salvation event.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Now every person is for sale. It is a matter of for what or how much. We are negotiable.
I know of no shelter except Jesus Christ. He is the only hiding place...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Each of us is made in the image of God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Charlemagne is used as the model of the 'wise' subject who points to the right values.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the Merchant who sells all He has (Christ) to buy the pearl of great price (the human soul).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to make the right choice; existential anxiety regarding the 'price' of one's life.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a transaction managed by the human subject.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent in its call to action, but the transition from 'valuing the soul' to 'Jesus as shelter' is abrupt and instrumental.
spanning_punten: The soul is 'essential integrity' yet 'for sale'.
The soul is 'eternal' yet can be 'lost' through a bad bargain.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Hear the word of Jesus as he asks...

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is described as 'dwelling' but functions as a latent 'instinct' rather than a transformative agent.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'selling too cheaply'—a failure of valuation rather than a state of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'wisdom' discourse where the hearer is the primary agent. God is the passive prize or the safety zone.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one 'selling' or 'giving' the soul.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the one who has already 'bought' the soul at the price of Christ.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'What shall a man give in exchange for his soul?', use 'See what God has given to ransom your soul.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the Slave on the auction block who is redeemed by a Kinsman-Redeemer.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Use the slavery imagery not just as a foil for integrity, but as a metaphor for the human condition under sin.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how Christ's death provides the 'Pouvoir' to live for God, which the hearer lacks.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: The opponent is the 'clutch of death' and 'sin' which man cannot escape by a better bargain.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'bad taste' in prizes, grace is not necessary, only better education.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (valuing the soul) precedes Soteriology (Jesus as shelter).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God values you) → Ethics (Therefore, do not sell yourself to the world).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful rhetorical grip and high regard for human dignity, but it risks leaving the hearer as the savior of their own soul.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is brilliant and persuasive; actantially, it is a legalistic 'deal'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Mt 16:26 often ignores that Jesus is the one going to the Cross in the context; the sermon follows this omission.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Jesus' in this sermon is a 'Helper' actant rather than the 'Subject' of the salvation narrative.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Value' of the soul (Object) to motivate the Subject (Hearer), creating a 'Commercial' soteriology.
